page.title: 15Val de la Mare Reservoir
page.content:
The post 1945{increase in {population, tourism and general {prosperity}soon created pressure on the island's water supplies. The Val de la Mare Reservoir was built in the early 1960s to hold some 200 million gallons of water.
This did not prove enough and in the later 1960s a{desalination plant}was built on the SW corner of the island. The water from this distillation plant is pumped from the SW across the block and into Val de la Mare reservoir so as to make it more palatable.
The dam has suffered from{"concrete {disease",}a type of alkali reaction which has been largely coped with at present. There are many who would wish to raise the present dam to create much greater storage.
